property.name: hadoop.common.configuration.version
property.description: version of this configuration file

property.name: hadoop.tmp.dir
property.description: A base for other temporary directories.

property.name: io.native.lib.available
property.description: Should native hadoop libraries, if present, be used.

property.name: hadoop.http.filter.initializers
property.description: A comma separated list of class names. Each class in the list must extend org.apache.hadoop.http.FilterInitializer. The corresponding Filter will be initialized. Then, the Filter will be applied to all user facing jsp and servlet web pages. The ordering of the list defines the ordering of the filters.

property.name: hadoop.security.authorization
property.description: Is service-level authorization enabled?

property.name: hadoop.security.instrumentation.requires.admin
property.description: Indicates if administrator ACLs are required to access instrumentation servlets (JMX, METRICS, CONF, STACKS).

property.name: hadoop.security.authentication
property.description: Possible values are simple (no authentication), and kerberos

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping
property.description: Class for user to group mapping (get groups for a given user) for ACL. The default implementation, org.apache.hadoop.security.JniBasedUnixGroupsMappingWithFallback, will determine if the Java Native Interface (JNI) is available. If JNI is available the implementation will use the API within hadoop to resolve a list of groups for a user. If JNI is not available then the shell implementation, ShellBasedUnixGroupsMapping, is used. This implementation shells out to the Linux/Unix environment with the bash -c groups command to resolve a list of groups for a user.

property.name: hadoop.security.groups.cache.secs
property.description: This is the config controlling the validity of the entries in the cache containing the user->group mapping. When this duration has expired, then the implementation of the group mapping provider is invoked to get the groups of the user and then cached back.

property.name: hadoop.security.groups.cache.warn.after.ms
property.description: If looking up a single user to group takes longer than this amount of milliseconds, we will log a warning message.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.url
property.description: The URL of the LDAP server to use for resolving user groups when using the LdapGroupsMapping user to group mapping.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.ssl
property.description: Whether or not to use SSL when connecting to the LDAP server.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.ssl.keystore
property.description: File path to the SSL keystore that contains the SSL certificate required by the LDAP server.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.ssl.keystore.password.file
property.description:
The path to a file containing the password of the LDAP SSL keystore.
IMPORTANT: This file should be readable only by the Unix user running the daemons.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.bind.user
property.description: The distinguished name of the user to bind as when connecting to the LDAP server. This may be left blank if the LDAP server supports anonymous binds.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.bind.password.file
property.description:
The path to a file containing the password of the bind user.
IMPORTANT: This file should be readable only by the Unix user running the daemons.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.base
property.description: The search base for the LDAP connection. This is a distinguished name, and will typically be the root of the LDAP directory.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.search.filter.user
property.description: An additional filter to use when searching for LDAP users. The default will usually be appropriate for Active Directory installations. If connecting to an LDAP server with a non-AD schema, this should be replaced with (&(objectClass=inetOrgPerson)(uid={0}). {0} is a special string used to denote where the username fits into the filter.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.search.filter.group
property.description: An additional filter to use when searching for LDAP groups. This should be changed when resolving groups against a non-Active Directory installation. posixGroups are currently not a supported group class.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.search.attr.member
property.description: The attribute of the group object that identifies the users that are members of the group. The default will usually be appropriate for any LDAP installation.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.search.attr.group.name
property.description: The attribute of the group object that identifies the group name. The default will usually be appropriate for all LDAP systems.

property.name: hadoop.security.group.mapping.ldap.directory.search.timeout
property.description: The attribute applied to the LDAP SearchControl properties to set a maximum time limit when searching and awaiting a result. Set to 0 if infinite wait period is desired. Default is 10 seconds. Units in milliseconds.

property.name: hadoop.security.service.user.name.key
property.description: For those cases where the same RPC protocol is implemented by multiple servers, this configuration is required for specifying the principal name to use for the service when the client wishes to make an RPC call.

property.name: hadoop.security.uid.cache.secs
property.description: This is the config controlling the validity of the entries in the cache containing the userId to userName and groupId to groupName used by NativeIO getFstat().

property.name: hadoop.rpc.protection
property.description: This field sets the quality of protection for secured sasl connections. Possible values are authentication, integrity and privacy. authentication means authentication only and no integrity or privacy; integrity implies authentication and integrity are enabled; and privacy implies all of authentication, integrity and privacy are enabled.

property.name: hadoop.work.around.non.threadsafe.getpwuid
property.description:
Some operating systems or authentication modules are known to have broken implementations of getpwuid_r and getpwgid_r, such that these calls are not thread-safe. Symptoms of this problem include JVM crashes with a stack trace inside these functions. If your system exhibits this issue, enable this configuration parameter to include a lock around the calls as a workaround.
An incomplete list of some systems known to have this issue is available at http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/KnownBrokenPwuidImplementations

property.name: hadoop.kerberos.kinit.command
property.description: Used to periodically renew Kerberos credentials when provided to Hadoop. The default setting assumes that kinit is in the PATH of users running the Hadoop client. Change this to the absolute path to kinit if this is not the case.

property.name: hadoop.security.auth_to_local
property.description: Maps kerberos principals to local user names

property.name: io.file.buffer.size
property.description: The size of buffer for use in sequence files. The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is buffered during read and write operations.

property.name: io.bytes.per.checksum
property.description: The number of bytes per checksum. Must not be larger than io.file.buffer.size.

property.name: io.skip.checksum.errors
property.description: If true, when a checksum error is encountered while reading a sequence file, entries are skipped, instead of throwing an exception.

property.name: io.compression.codecs
property.description: A comma-separated list of the compression codec classes that can be used for compression/decompression. In addition to any classes specified with this property (which take precedence), codec classes on the classpath are discovered using a Java ServiceLoader.

property.name: io.compression.codec.bzip2.library
property.description:
The native-code library to be used for compression and decompression by the bzip2 codec. This library could be specified either by by name or the full pathname. In the former case, the library is located by the dynamic linker, usually searching the directories specified in the environment variable LD_LIBRARY_PATH.
The value of "system-native" indicates that the default system library should be used. To indicate that the algorithm should operate entirely in Java, specify "java-builtin".

property.name: io.serializations
property.description: A list of serialization classes that can be used for obtaining serializers and deserializers.

property.name: io.seqfile.local.dir
property.description: The local directory where sequence file stores intermediate data files during merge. May be a comma-separated list of directories on different devices in order to spread disk i/o. Directories that do not exist are ignored.

property.name: io.map.index.skip
property.description: Number of index entries to skip between each entry. Zero by default. Setting this to values larger than zero can facilitate opening large MapFiles using less memory.

property.name: io.map.index.interval
property.description: MapFile consist of two files - data file (tuples) and index file (keys). For every io.map.index.interval records written in the data file, an entry (record-key, data-file-position) is written in the index file. This is to allow for doing binary search later within the index file to look up records by their keys and get their closest positions in the data file.

property.name: fs.defaultFS
property.description: The name of the default file system. A URI whose scheme and authority determine the FileSystem implementation. The uri's scheme determines the config property (fs.SCHEME.impl) naming the FileSystem implementation class. The uri's authority is used to determine the host, port, etc. for a filesystem.

property.name: fs.default.name
property.description: Deprecated. Use (fs.defaultFS) property instead

property.name: fs.trash.interval
property.description: Number of minutes after which the checkpoint gets deleted. If zero, the trash feature is disabled. This option may be configured both on the server and the client. If trash is disabled server side then the client side configuration is checked. If trash is enabled on the server side then the value configured on the server is used and the client configuration value is ignored.

property.name: fs.trash.checkpoint.interval
property.description: Number of minutes between trash checkpoints. Should be smaller or equal to fs.trash.interval. If zero, the value is set to the value of fs.trash.interval. Every time the checkpointer runs it creates a new checkpoint out of current and removes checkpoints created more than fs.trash.interval minutes ago.

property.name: fs.AbstractFileSystem.file.impl
property.description: The AbstractFileSystem for file: uris.

property.name: fs.AbstractFileSystem.hdfs.impl
property.description: The FileSystem for hdfs: uris.

property.name: fs.AbstractFileSystem.viewfs.impl
property.description: The AbstractFileSystem for view file system for viewfs: uris (ie client side mount table:).

property.name: fs.ftp.host
property.description: FTP filesystem connects to this server

property.name: fs.ftp.host.port
property.description: FTP filesystem connects to fs.ftp.host on this port

property.name: fs.df.interval
property.description: Disk usage statistics refresh interval in msec.

property.name: fs.du.interval
property.description: File space usage statistics refresh interval in msec.

property.name: fs.s3.block.size
property.description: Block size to use when writing files to S3.

property.name: fs.s3.buffer.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem the S3 filesystem should store files before sending them to S3 (or after retrieving them from S3).

property.name: fs.s3.maxRetries
property.description: The maximum number of retries for reading or writing files to S3, before we signal failure to the application.

property.name: fs.s3.sleepTimeSeconds
property.description: The number of seconds to sleep between each S3 retry.

property.name: fs.swift.impl
property.description: The implementation class of the OpenStack Swift Filesystem

property.name: fs.automatic.close
property.description: By default, FileSystem instances are automatically closed at program exit using a JVM shutdown hook. Setting this property to false disables this behavior. This is an advanced option that should only be used by server applications requiring a more carefully orchestrated shutdown sequence.

property.name: fs.s3n.block.size
property.description: Block size to use when reading files using the native S3 filesystem (s3n: URIs).

property.name: io.seqfile.compress.blocksize
property.description: The minimum block size for compression in block compressed SequenceFiles.

property.name: io.seqfile.lazydecompress
property.description: Should values of block-compressed SequenceFiles be decompressed only when necessary.

property.name: io.seqfile.sorter.recordlimit
property.description: The limit on number of records to be kept in memory in a spill in SequenceFiles.Sorter

property.name: io.mapfile.bloom.size
property.description: The size of BloomFilter-s used in BloomMapFile. Each time this many keys is appended the next BloomFilter will be created (inside a DynamicBloomFilter). Larger values minimize the number of filters, which slightly increases the performance, but may waste too much space if the total number of keys is usually much smaller than this number.

property.name: io.mapfile.bloom.error.rate
property.description: The rate of false positives in BloomFilter-s used in BloomMapFile. As this value decreases, the size of BloomFilter-s increases exponentially. This value is the probability of encountering false positives (default is 0.5%).

property.name: hadoop.util.hash.type
property.description: The default implementation of Hash. Currently this can take one of the two values: 'murmur' to select MurmurHash and 'jenkins' to select JenkinsHash.

property.name: ipc.client.idlethreshold
property.description: Defines the threshold number of connections after which connections will be inspected for idleness.

property.name: ipc.client.kill.max
property.description: Defines the maximum number of clients to disconnect in one go.

property.name: ipc.client.connection.maxidletime
property.description: The maximum time in msec after which a client will bring down the connection to the server.

property.name: ipc.client.connect.max.retries
property.description: Indicates the number of retries a client will make to establish a server connection.

property.name: ipc.client.connect.retry.interval
property.description: Indicates the number of milliseconds a client will wait for before retrying to establish a server connection.

property.name: ipc.client.connect.timeout
property.description: Indicates the number of milliseconds a client will wait for the socket to establish a server connection.

property.name: ipc.client.connect.max.retries.on.timeouts
property.description: Indicates the number of retries a client will make on socket timeout to establish a server connection.

property.name: ipc.server.listen.queue.size
property.description: Indicates the length of the listen queue for servers accepting client connections.

property.name: ipc.server.tcpnodelay
property.description: Turn on/off Nagle's algorithm for the TCP socket connection on the server. Setting to true disables the algorithm and may decrease latency with a cost of more/smaller packets.

property.name: ipc.client.tcpnodelay
property.description: Turn on/off Nagle's algorithm for the TCP socket connection on the client. Setting to true disables the algorithm and may decrease latency with a cost of more/smaller packets.

property.name: hadoop.rpc.socket.factory.class.default
property.description: Default SocketFactory to use. This parameter is expected to be formatted as "package.FactoryClassName".

property.name: hadoop.rpc.socket.factory.class.ClientProtocol
property.description: SocketFactory to use to connect to a DFS. If null or empty, use hadoop.rpc.socket.class.default. This socket factory is also used by DFSClient to create sockets to DataNodes.

property.name: hadoop.socks.server
property.description: Address (host:port) of the SOCKS server to be used by the SocksSocketFactory.

property.name: net.topology.node.switch.mapping.impl
property.description: The default implementation of the DNSToSwitchMapping. It invokes a script specified in net.topology.script.file.name to resolve node names. If the value for net.topology.script.file.name is not set, the default value of DEFAULT_RACK is returned for all node names.

property.name: net.topology.impl
property.description: The default implementation of NetworkTopology which is classic three layer one.

property.name: net.topology.script.file.name
property.description: The script name that should be invoked to resolve DNS names to NetworkTopology names. Example: the script would take host.foo.bar as an argument, and return /rack1 as the output.

property.name: net.topology.script.number.args
property.description: The max number of args that the script configured with net.topology.script.file.name should be run with. Each arg is an IP address.

property.name: net.topology.table.file.name
property.description: The file name for a topology file, which is used when the net.topology.node.switch.mapping.impl property is set to org.apache.hadoop.net.TableMapping. The file format is a two column text file, with columns separated by whitespace. The first column is a DNS or IP address and the second column specifies the rack where the address maps. If no entry corresponding to a host in the cluster is found, then /default-rack is assumed.

property.name: file.stream-buffer-size
property.description: The size of buffer to stream files. The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is buffered during read and write operations.

property.name: file.bytes-per-checksum
property.description: The number of bytes per checksum. Must not be larger than file.stream-buffer-size

property.name: file.client-write-packet-size
property.description: Packet size for clients to write

property.name: file.blocksize
property.description: Block size

property.name: file.replication
property.description: Replication factor

property.name: s3.stream-buffer-size
property.description: The size of buffer to stream files. The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is buffered during read and write operations.

property.name: s3.bytes-per-checksum
property.description: The number of bytes per checksum. Must not be larger than s3.stream-buffer-size

property.name: s3.client-write-packet-size
property.description: Packet size for clients to write

property.name: s3.blocksize
property.description: Block size

property.name: s3.replication
property.description: Replication factor

property.name: s3native.stream-buffer-size
property.description: The size of buffer to stream files. The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is buffered during read and write operations.

property.name: s3native.bytes-per-checksum
property.description: The number of bytes per checksum. Must not be larger than s3native.stream-buffer-size

property.name: s3native.client-write-packet-size
property.description: Packet size for clients to write

property.name: s3native.blocksize
property.description: Block size

property.name: s3native.replication
property.description: Replication factor

property.name: ftp.stream-buffer-size
property.description: The size of buffer to stream files. The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is buffered during read and write operations.

property.name: ftp.bytes-per-checksum
property.description: The number of bytes per checksum. Must not be larger than ftp.stream-buffer-size

property.name: ftp.client-write-packet-size
property.description: Packet size for clients to write

property.name: ftp.blocksize
property.description: Block size

property.name: ftp.replication
property.description: Replication factor

property.name: tfile.io.chunk.size
property.description: Value chunk size in bytes. Default to 1MB. Values of the length less than the chunk size is guaranteed to have known value length in read time (See also TFile.Reader.Scanner.Entry.isValueLengthKnown()).

property.name: tfile.fs.output.buffer.size
property.description: Buffer size used for FSDataOutputStream in bytes.

property.name: tfile.fs.input.buffer.size
property.description: Buffer size used for FSDataInputStream in bytes.

property.name: hadoop.http.authentication.type
property.description: Defines authentication used for Oozie HTTP endpoint. Supported values are: simple | kerberos | #AUTHENTICATION_HANDLER_CLASSNAME#

property.name: hadoop.http.authentication.token.validity
property.description: Indicates how long (in seconds) an authentication token is valid before it has to be renewed.

property.name: hadoop.http.authentication.signature.secret.file
property.description: The signature secret for signing the authentication tokens. The same secret should be used for JT/NN/DN/TT configurations.

property.name: hadoop.http.authentication.cookie.domain
property.description: The domain to use for the HTTP cookie that stores the authentication token. In order to authentiation to work correctly across all Hadoop nodes web-consoles the domain must be correctly set. IMPORTANT: when using IP addresses, browsers ignore cookies with domain settings. For this setting to work properly all nodes in the cluster must be configured to generate URLs with hostname.domain names on it.

property.name: hadoop.http.authentication.simple.anonymous.allowed
property.description: Indicates if anonymous requests are allowed when using 'simple' authentication.

property.name: hadoop.http.authentication.kerberos.principal
property.description: Indicates the Kerberos principal to be used for HTTP endpoint. The principal MUST start with 'HTTP/' as per Kerberos HTTP SPNEGO specification.

property.name: hadoop.http.authentication.kerberos.keytab
property.description: Location of the keytab file with the credentials for the principal. Referring to the same keytab file Oozie uses for its Kerberos credentials for Hadoop.

property.name: dfs.ha.fencing.methods
property.description: List of fencing methods to use for service fencing. May contain builtin methods (eg shell and sshfence) or user-defined method.

property.name: dfs.ha.fencing.ssh.connect-timeout
property.description: SSH connection timeout, in milliseconds, to use with the builtin sshfence fencer.

property.name: dfs.ha.fencing.ssh.private-key-files
property.description: The SSH private key files to use with the builtin sshfence fencer.
The user name to filter as, on static web filters while rendering content. An example use is the HDFS web UI (user to be used for browsing files).
property.name: hadoop.http.staticuser.user
ha.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: A list of ZooKeeper server addresses, separated by commas, that are to be used by the ZKFailoverController in automatic failover.

property.name: ha.zookeeper.session-timeout.ms
property.description: The session timeout to use when the ZKFC connects to ZooKeeper. Setting this value to a lower value implies that server crashes will be detected more quickly, but risks triggering failover too aggressively in the case of a transient error or network blip.

property.name: ha.zookeeper.parent-znode
property.description: The ZooKeeper znode under which the ZK failover controller stores its information. Note that the nameservice ID is automatically appended to this znode, so it is not normally necessary to configure this, even in a federated environment.

property.name: ha.zookeeper.acl
property.description:
A comma-separated list of ZooKeeper ACLs to apply to the znodes used by automatic failover. These ACLs are specified in the same format as used by the ZooKeeper CLI.
If the ACL itself contains secrets, you may instead specify a path to a file, prefixed with the '@' symbol, and the value of this configuration will be loaded from within.

property.name: ha.zookeeper.auth
property.description:
A comma-separated list of ZooKeeper authentications to add when connecting to ZooKeeper. These are specified in the same format as used by the "addauth" command in the ZK CLI. It is important that the authentications specified here are sufficient to access znodes with the ACL specified in ha.zookeeper.acl.
If the auths contain secrets, you may instead specify a path to a file, prefixed with the '@' symbol, and the value of this configuration will be loaded from within.

property.name: hadoop.ssl.keystores.factory.class
property.description: The keystores factory to use for retrieving certificates.

property.name: hadoop.ssl.require.client.cert
property.description: Whether client certificates are required

property.name: hadoop.ssl.hostname.verifier
property.description: The hostname verifier to provide for HttpsURLConnections. Valid values are: DEFAULT, STRICT, STRICT_I6, DEFAULT_AND_LOCALHOST and ALLOW_ALL

property.name: hadoop.ssl.server.conf
property.description: Resource file from which ssl server keystore information will be extracted. This file is looked up in the classpath, typically it should be in Hadoop conf/ directory.

property.name: hadoop.ssl.client.conf
property.description: Resource file from which ssl client keystore information will be extracted This file is looked up in the classpath, typically it should be in Hadoop conf/ directory.

property.name: hadoop.ssl.enabled
property.description: Deprecated. Use dfs.http.policy and yarn.http.policy instead.

property.name: hadoop.jetty.logs.serve.aliases
property.description: Enable/Disable aliases serving from jetty

property.name: fs.permissions.umask-mode
property.description: The umask used when creating files and directories. Can be in octal or in symbolic. Examples are: "022" (octal for u=rwx,g=r-x,o=r-x in symbolic), or "u=rwx,g=rwx,o=" (symbolic for 007 in octal).

property.name: ha.health-monitor.connect-retry-interval.ms
property.description: How often to retry connecting to the service.

property.name: ha.health-monitor.check-interval.ms
property.description: How often to check the service.

property.name: ha.health-monitor.sleep-after-disconnect.ms
property.description: How long to sleep after an unexpected RPC error.

property.name: ha.health-monitor.rpc-timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout for the actual monitorHealth() calls.

property.name: ha.failover-controller.new-active.rpc-timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout that the FC waits for the new active to become active

property.name: ha.failover-controller.graceful-fence.rpc-timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout that the FC waits for the old active to go to standby

property.name: ha.failover-controller.graceful-fence.connection.retries
property.description: FC connection retries for graceful fencing

property.name: ha.failover-controller.cli-check.rpc-timeout.ms
property.description: Timeout that the CLI (manual) FC waits for monitorHealth, getServiceState

property.name: ipc.client.fallback-to-simple-auth-allowed
property.description: When a client is configured to attempt a secure connection, but attempts to connect to an insecure server, that server may instruct the client to switch to SASL SIMPLE (unsecure) authentication. This setting controls whether or not the client will accept this instruction from the server. When false (the default), the client will not allow the fallback to SIMPLE authentication, and will abort the connection.

property.name: fs.client.resolve.remote.symlinks
property.description: Whether to resolve symlinks when accessing a remote Hadoop filesystem. Setting this to false causes an exception to be thrown upon encountering a symlink. This setting does not apply to local filesystems, which automatically resolve local symlinks.

property.name: nfs3.server.port
property.description: Specify the port number used by Hadoop NFS.

property.name: nfs3.mountd.port
property.description: Specify the port number used by Hadoop mount daemon.

property.name: hadoop.user.group.static.mapping.overrides
property.description: Static mapping of user to groups. This will override the groups if available in the system for the specified user. In otherwords, groups look-up will not happen for these users, instead groups mapped in this configuration will be used. Mapping should be in this format. user1=group1,group2;user2=;user3=group2; Default, "dr.who=;" will consider "dr.who" as user without groups.

property.name: rpc.metrics.quantile.enable
property.description: Setting this property to true and rpc.metrics.percentiles.intervals to a comma-separated list of the granularity in seconds, the 50/75/90/95/99th percentile latency for rpc queue/processing time in milliseconds are added to rpc metrics.

property.name: rpc.metrics.percentiles.intervals
property.description: A comma-separated list of the granularity in seconds for the metrics which describe the 50/75/90/95/99th percentile latency for rpc queue/processing time. The metrics are outputted if rpc.metrics.quantile.enable is set to true.
